item.title: Testing in Asp Dotnet Core Using Xunit
item.description: Testing is a critical aspect of software development, ensuring that your code is reliable, maintainable, and free of bugs. In ASP.NET Core, xUnit is a popular testing framework due to its flexibility, powerful features, and ease of use. This blog post will explore the essentials of testing in ASP.NET Core using xUnit, including practical examples with InlineData, MemberData, ClassData, and TheoryData. We’ll also cover the advantages, disadvantages, and best practices for each approach.

item.title: Load Stress Testing Dotnet Core Web Api With Apache Jmeter
item.description: Load and stress testing are essential aspects of ensuring the performance and reliability of web APIs. In this blog post, we’ll look into how to effectively conduct load and stress testing for ASP.NET Core 8 Web API using Apache JMeter. We’ll cover the rationale behind load and stress testing, their advantages and disadvantages, detailed methodologies, and best practices. Understanding Load and Stress Testing What are Load and Stress Testing? Load testing involves simulating expected usage patterns on a software application to assess its behavior under normal and peak conditions.
